meanings.definition: To provide an incorrect caption for a picture or video.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally miscaptioned the photo of her cat as a dog.
meanings.sent2: The journalist miscaptioned the image, causing confusion among readers.
meanings.sent3: The miscaptioned picture made it seem like the cat was the one driving the car!
meanings.sent4: Her words miscaptioned the scene, painting a false narrative in the minds of viewers.
meanings.sent5: The miscaptioned photo stuck in my mind, creating a lasting impression of the event.

meanings.sent1: The miscaptioned file led to a mix-up in the office.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the miscaptioned information on the poster.
meanings.sent3: The miscaptioned book cover made the novel seem like a mystery thriller!
meanings.sent4: Her miscaptioned description of the painting left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The miscaptioned label on the box caused delays in the shipment process.
